generalInfo.history: With over 2,800 years of history, Málaga is one of the oldest cities in the world. It has been ruled by many different cultures, including the Romans, Moors, and Christians, which is reflected in its architecture and cultural heritage.
generalInfo.culture: Málaga is a city rich in culture, with many museums, art galleries, and annual festivals. Some notable cultural sites include the Picasso Museum and the Alcazaba of Málaga, a Moorish fortress.
funFacts: Pablo Picasso was born in Málaga
Málaga has over 300 sunny days a year

dayTrips.name: Nerja
dayTrips.description: A beautiful coastal town with stunning beaches and a charming old town.

dayTrips.name: Ronda
dayTrips.description: A gorgeous mountain town known for its dramatic landscape and historic bullring.

dayTrips.name: Granada
dayTrips.description: Home to the famous Alhambra palace and the Sierra Nevada mountains.
